Articles.Content:
Hi All

If I have a space station, which is made up of a pod, a few hitchhiker pods in a long tube, maybe a docking port in the middle? Can Kerbals move throughout the station inside? Or do you have to EVA to go next door?

Edited June 30, 2014 by stildawn
Nope, uou can't do that. However, there are mods that allow transfers of kerbals through parts.

Pretty weird not to, hopefully they will implement that eventually.

What mod is that?
I think that mod is called Crew Manifest. And it has rules about what parts let Kerbals go through them, so you need to mind that.
There is also an interesting mod, called Connected Living Space you can try it too.
Kerbals can move throughout ships, use the ShipManifest mod. This is one of the many issues that modders fixed before Squad.

Or do you have to EVA to go next door?

If you stick with vanilla, EVA it is. Ladders everywhere make things helpful otherwise you're gonna be using monoprop each time you want to move compartment.

If you stick with vanilla, EVA it is. Ladders everywhere make things helpful otherwise you're gonna be using monoprop each time you want to move compartment.

I'm also fairly certain if you are going into a hitchhiker it doesn't refill either.
What's the name of that mod that adds parts with big windows where you can move the Kerbals around inside?
Is it Lack Luster Labs? I just know of the big windows, though.

If you want just to move kerbals (like fuel), Kerbal Crew Transfer is the least cluttered choice (with optional CLS support) - http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/82101-0-23-5-Kerbal-Crew-Transfer-v0-4-released

Connected Living Space by itself does not have transfer capability, it just calculates correctly where from/to its possible to travel.
